content:
re :Thanks for your reply but if you had read my initial post you would be able to understand that I am having trouble with both; I know.

Have you completely uninstalled all the addons eg: phoenity and old icons and any other you have installed. then restarted Thunderbird and then download and install 'old icons'

So you only have one of those addons installed at any time - I do not mean just disabled - I mean others are uninstalled before you try another.

It's no good as a test if you had two types or more installed and you only removed one of them, leaving one installed. You have to uninstall all of the addons and restart and then perform a separate download and also make sure you are installing the correct version.

You have not stated that you uninstalled all of them, restarted and downloaded eg: old icons a fresh.

Lets get something very clear. If you have no problems when you uninstall all the addons then the issue is with the addon. All addons have to work with Thunderbird and not the other way around.

It's very obvious, either the addon does not work due to a clash with another addon or the addon is not compatible.

What other addons do you have installed?
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Thanks for your reply but if you had read my initial post you would be able to understand that I am having trouble with both; https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/phoenity-icons/ and https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/old-icons/ not just one of the add-ons. As much as I appreciate what you are saying it seems to me that if I am having the same problem with both add-ons then it is a Thunderbird 'glitch' not anything to do with one of the add-ons so the authors aren't going to be interested in solving a problem which is nothing to do with their particular development. I have uninstalled 'Old Icons,' and restarted Thunderbird and as I said in my initial post the Phoenity icons flash up and then disappear almost instantly so no resolution there. It sounds as if I am a voice in the wilderness here and am not going to get any help or support so I suggest I'll just put up with the problem or try to solve it myself. Great outcome from Mozilla Support.
creator: njtinker

content:
I presume you are talking about:

  • https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/old-icons/

Matt's comment is valid and accurate. Addons are not created by Thunderbird. They are a piece of code written by a person - an author - and they are solely responsible for their addon. If you experience a problem with an addon then you need to communicate with the author. It may be useful information for the author. At the link above, on the right hand side of window, there is a 'Support Email' link you can use to email the person responsible for the add-on.

However, before you go down that route, you mentioned you had previously used other addons for buttons/folders etc. The area of code being manipulated is the same when using addons that perform same type of functionality. So, it is possible there is some conflict in the code - basically one addon is messing up another addon.

Did you fully uninstall the Phoenity Icons and Buttons addons and restart Thunderbird to ensure they had been removed? If no then I would do this first.

The alternative would be remove addons and use the 'userChrome.css' method to insert and use old folder pane folder icons.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Depends on what you are looking for as to what answer is given. What is your definition of a template?

I see the native templates as basically useless except as a source of boiler plate text.

The mail merge addon offers the features of merging data from address books or CSV files into individual emails a very handy tool in it's own right. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/mail-merge/

Then there is the smart templates https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/smarttemplate4/ This is probably what you are looking for.

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help you.


Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.


If you have a pop account, check the recycle bin to see if it is empty. Even if you can do it, compressing is sometimes helpful, but also the "Repair folder" via your right mouse button on the Inbox.(properties).

If you have an imap account, it may be that you have reached the maximum storage capacity of your provider, then cleaning up is highly desirable.


Greetings firefox volunteer.
creator: googlethunderbird

content: Try using a filter. Create a filter with the criteria for the messages you wish to move - a date range for example. Then run it on the folder that contains the source message. It will be slower but far more likely to succeed.

content:
The memory usage looks ok; I have 16GB and 12.75GB is being used. Whilst the transfer process is running, Thunderbird is using 900MB and I've seen this go up to 1GB.

The process appears to stop when I'm not using the computer for a while and the lock screen is activated. I set the transfer running yesterday and continued to use the computer for several hours and the process continued with no issues, so cause appears to be when there is a period of inactivity. I assume this process should continue to run despite me not being active on the system? I'm not sure if this is an issue with Thunderbird or how macOS works?
creator: mark369

content: Check your ram usage before and during the transfer. If that checks out, you might want to either try transferring in smaller batches (which can get annoying) or submitting a bug report on it. If you need help with the latter, reach out and I'll do my best to walk you through the process

content: I don't think you need TBird in this case. I did a bit of digging and found this article from iinet https://help.iinet.net.au/iinet-email-messaging-company Long story short, the entirety of your iinet account is going to migrate to the Messaging Company and as long as you follow the steps in the link above you shouldn't lose any data. Afterwards, if you still wish to use TBird then it's as simple as signing in with your usual email and password. Let me know if that answers your question and also if you continue to need help but remember you need to migrate your account first because TBird isn't a domain but a client.
